nop.description: Null operation : machine code is all zeroes

add $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Addition with overflow : set $t1 to ($t2 plus $t3)

addi $t1,$t2,-100.description: Addition immediate with overflow : set $t1 to ($t2 plus signed 16-bit immediate)

addiu $t1,$t2,-100.description: Addition immediate unsigned without overflow : set $t1 to ($t2 plus signed 16-bit immediate), no overflow

addu $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Addition unsigned without overflow : set $t1 to ($t2 plus $t3), no overflow

add.d $f2,$f4,$f6.description: Floating point addition double precision : Set $f2 to double-precision floating point value of $f4 plus $f6

add.s $f0,$f1,$f3.description: Floating point addition single precision : Set $f0 to single-precision floating point value of $f1 plus $f3

sub $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Subtraction with overflow : set $t1 to ($t2 minus $t3)

subu $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Subtraction unsigned without overflow : set $t1 to ($t2 minus $t3), no overflow

mult $t1,$t2.description: Multiplication : Set hi to high-order 32 bits, lo to low-order 32 bits of the product of $t1 and $t2 (use mfhi to access hi, mflo to access lo)

multu $t1,$t2.description: Multiplication unsigned : Set HI to high-order 32 bits, LO to low-order 32 bits of the product of unsigned $t1 and $t2 (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

mul $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Multiplication without overflow  : Set HI to high-order 32 bits, LO and $t1 to low-order 32 bits of the product of $t2 and $t3 (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

mul.d $f2,$f4,$f6.description: Floating point multiplication double precision : Set $f2 to double-precision floating point value of $f4 times $f6

mul.s $f0,$f1,$f3.description: Floating point multiplication single precision : Set $f0 to single-precision floating point value of $f1 times $f3

madd $t1,$t2.description: Multiply add : Multiply $t1 by $t2 then increment HI by high-order 32 bits of product, increment LO by low-order 32 bits of product (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

maddu $t1,$t2.description: Multiply add unsigned : Multiply $t1 by $t2 then increment HI by high-order 32 bits of product, increment LO by low-order 32 bits of product, unsigned (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

msub $t1,$t2.description: Multiply subtract : Multiply $t1 by $t2 then decrement HI by high-order 32 bits of product, decrement LO by low-order 32 bits of product (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

msubu $t1,$t2.description: Multiply subtract unsigned : Multiply $t1 by $t2 then decrement HI by high-order 32 bits of product, decement LO by low-order 32 bits of product, unsigned (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

div $t1,$t2.description: Division with overflow : Divide $t1 by $t2 then set LO to quotient and HI to remainder (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

divu $t1,$t2.description: Division unsigned without overflow : Divide unsigned $t1 by $t2 then set LO to quotient and HI to remainder (use mfhi to access HI, mflo to access LO)

mfhi $t1.description: Move from HI register : Set $t1 to contents of HI (see multiply and divide operations)

mflo $t1.description: Move from LO register : Set $t1 to contents of LO (see multiply and divide operations)

mthi $t1.description: Move to HI registerr : Set HI to contents of $t1 (see multiply and divide operations)

mtlo $t1.description: Move to LO register : Set LO to contents of $t1 (see multiply and divide operations)

and $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Bitwise AND : Set $t1 to bitwise AND of $t2 and $t3

or $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Bitwise OR : Set $t1 to bitwise OR of $t2 and $t3

andi $t1,$t2,100.description: Bitwise AND immediate : Set $t1 to bitwise AND of $t2 and zero-extended 16-bit immediate

ori $t1,$t2,100.description: Bitwise OR immediate : Set $t1 to bitwise OR of $t2 and zero-extended 16-bit immediate

nor $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Bitwise NOR : Set $t1 to bitwise NOR of $t2 and $t3

xor $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Bitwise XOR (exclusive OR) : Set $t1 to bitwise XOR of $t2 and $t3

xori $t1,$t2,100.description: Bitwise XOR immediate : Set $t1 to bitwise XOR of $t2 and zero-extended 16-bit immediate

sll $t1,$t2,10.description: Shift left logical : Set $t1 to result of shifting $t2 left by number of bits specified by immediate

sllv $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Shift left logical variable : Set $t1 to result of shifting $t2 left by number of bits specified by value in low-order 5 bits of $t3

srl $t1,$t2,10.description: Shift right logical : Set $t1 to result of shifting $t2 right by number of bits specified by immediate

sra $t1,$t2,10.description: Shift right arithmetic : Set $t1 to result of sign-extended shifting $t2 right by number of bits specified by immediate

srav $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Shift right arithmetic variable : Set $t1 to result of sign-extended shifting $t2 right by number of bits specified by value in low-order 5 bits of $t3

srlv $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Shift right logical variable : Set $t1 to result of shifting $t2 right by number of bits specified by value in low-order 5 bits of $t3

lw $t1,-100($t2).description: Load word : Set $t1 to contents of effective memory word address

ll $t1,-100($t2).description: Load linked : Paired with Store Conditional (sc) to perform atomic read-modify-write.  Treated as equivalent to Load Word (lw) because MARS does not simulate multiple processors.

lwl $t1,-100($t2).description: Load word left : Load from 1 to 4 bytes left-justified into $t1, starting with effective memory byte address and continuing through the low-order byte of its word

lwr $t1,-100($t2).description: Load word right : Load from 1 to 4 bytes right-justified into $t1, starting with effective memory byte address and continuing through the high-order byte of its word

lui $t1,100.description: Load upper immediate : Set high-order 16 bits of $t1 to 16-bit immediate and low-order 16 bits to 0

sw $t1,-100($t2).description: Store word : Store contents of $t1 into effective memory word address

sc $t1,-100($t2).description: Store conditional : Paired with Load Linked (ll) to perform atomic read-modify-write.  Stores $t1 value into effective address, then sets $t1 to 1 for success.  Always succeeds because MARS does not simulate multiple processors.

swl $t1,-100($t2).description: Store word left : Store high-order 1 to 4 bytes of $t1 into memory, starting with effective byte address and continuing through the low-order byte of its word

swr $t1,-100($t2).description: Store word right : Store low-order 1 to 4 bytes of $t1 into memory, starting with high-order byte of word containing effective byte address and continuing through that byte address

beq $t1,$t2,label.description: Branch if equal : Branch to statement at label's address if $t1 and $t2 are equal

bne $t1,$t2,label.description: Branch if not equal : Branch to statement at label's address if $t1 and $t2 are not equal

bgez $t1,label.description: Branch if greater than or equal to zero : Branch to statement at label's address if $t1 is greater than or equal to zero

bgezal $t1,label.description: Branch if greater then or equal to zero and link : If $t1 is greater than or equal to zero, then set $ra to the Program Counter and branch to statement at label's address

bgtz $t1,label.description: Branch if greater than zero : Branch to statement at label's address if $t1 is greater than zero

blez $t1,label.description: Branch if less than or equal to zero : Branch to statement at label's address if $t1 is less than or equal to zero

bltz $t1,label.description: Branch if less than zero : Branch to statement at label's address if $t1 is less than zero

bltzal $t1,label.description: Branch if less than zero and link : If $t1 is less than or equal to zero, then set $ra to the Program Counter and branch to statement at label's address

slt $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Set less than : If $t2 is less than $t3, then set $t1 to 1 else set $t1 to 0

sltu $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Set less than unsigned : If $t2 is less than $t3 using unsigned comparision, then set $t1 to 1 else set $t1 to 0

slti $t1,$t2,-100.description: Set less than immediate : If $t2 is less than sign-extended 16-bit immediate, then set $t1 to 1 else set $t1 to 0

sltiu $t1,$t2,-100.description: Set less than immediate unsigned : If $t2 is less than sign-extended 16-bit immediate using unsigned comparison, then set $t1 to 1 else set $t1 to 0

movn $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Move conditional not zero : Set $t1 to $t2 if $t3 is not zero

movz $t1,$t2,$t3.description: Move conditional zero : Set $t1 to $t2 if $t3 is zero

movf $t1,$t2.description: Move if FP condition flag 0 false : Set $t1 to $t2 if FPU (Coprocessor 1) condition flag 0 is false (zero)

movf $t1,$t2,1.description: Move if specified FP condition flag false : Set $t1 to $t2 if FPU (Coprocessor 1) condition flag specified by the immediate is false (zero)

movt $t1,$t2.description: Move if FP condition flag 0 true : Set $t1 to $t2 if FPU (Coprocessor 1) condition flag 0 is true (one)

movt $t1,$t2,1.description: Move if specfied FP condition flag true : Set $t1 to $t2 if FPU (Coprocessor 1) condition flag specified by the immediate is true (one)

break 100.description: Break execution with code : Terminate program execution with specified exception code

break.description: Break execution : Terminate program execution with exception

syscall.description: Issue a system call : Execute the system call specified by value in $v0

j target.description: Jump unconditionally : Jump to statement at target address

jr $t1.description: Jump register unconditionally : Jump to statement whose address is in $t1

jal target.description: Jump and link : Set $ra to Program Counter (return address) then jump to statement at target address

jalr $t1,$t2.description: Jump and link register : Set $t1 to Program Counter (return address) then jump to statement whose address is in $t2

jalr $t1.description: Jump and link register : Set $ra to Program Counter (return address) then jump to statement whose address is in $t1

lb $t1,-100($t2).description: Load byte : Set $t1 to sign-extended 8-bit value from effective memory byte address

lh $t1,-100($t2).description: Load halfword : Set $t1 to sign-extended 16-bit value from effective memory halfword address

lhu $t1,-100($t2).description: Load halfword unsigned : Set $t1 to zero-extended 16-bit value from effective memory halfword address

lbu $t1,-100($t2).description: Load byte unsigned : Set $t1 to zero-extended 8-bit value from effective memory byte address

sb $t1,-100($t2).description: Store byte : Store the low-order 8 bits of $t1 into the effective memory byte address

sh $t1,-100($t2).description: Store halfword : Store the low-order 16 bits of $t1 into the effective memory halfword address

clo $t1,$t2.description: Count number of leading ones : Set $t1 to the count of leading one bits in $t2 starting at most significant bit position

clz $t1,$t2.description: Count number of leading zeroes : Set $t1 to the count of leading zero bits in $t2 starting at most significant bit positio

mfc0 $t1,$8.description: Move from Coprocessor 0 : Set $t1 to the value stored in Coprocessor 0 register $8

mtc0 $t1,$8.description: Move to Coprocessor 0 : Set Coprocessor 0 register $8 to value stored in $t1

sub.s $f0,$f1,$f3.description: Floating point subtraction single precision : Set $f0 to single-precision floating point value of $f1  minus $f3

div.s $f0,$f1,$f3.description: Floating point division single precision : Set $f0 to single-precision floating point value of $f1 divided by $f3

div.d $f2,$f4,$f6.description: Floating point division double precision : Set $f2 to double-precision floating point value of $f4 divided by $f6

sqrt.d $f2,$f4.description: Square root double precision : Set $f2 to double-precision floating point square root of $f4

sqrt.s $f0,$f1.description: Square root single precision : Set $f0 to single-precision floating point square root of $f1

floor.w.s $f0,$f1.description: Floor single precision to word : Set $f0 to 32-bit integer floor of single-precision float in $f1

ceil.w.s $f0,$f1.description: Ceiling single precision to word : Set $f0 to 32-bit integer ceiling of single-precision float in $f1

round.w.s $f0,$f1.description: Round single precision to word : Set $f0 to 32-bit integer round of single-precision float in $f1

trunc.w.s $f0,$f1.description: Truncate single precision to word : Set $f0 to 32-bit integer truncation of single-precision float in $f1

sub.d $f2,$f4,$f6.description: Floating point subtraction double precision : Set $f2 to double-precision floating point value of $f4 minus $f6

floor.w.d $f1,$f2.description: Floor double precision to word : Set $f1 to 32-bit integer floor of double-precision float in $f2

ceil.w.d $f1,$f2.description: Ceiling double precision to word : Set $f1 to 32-bit integer ceiling of double-precision float in $f2

round.w.d $f1,$f2.description: Round double precision to word : Set $f1 to 32-bit integer round of double-precision float in $f2

trunc.w.d $f1,$f2.description: Truncate double precision to word : Set $f1 to 32-bit integer truncation of double-precision float in $f2

bc1t label.description: Branch if FP condition flag 0 true (BC1T, not BCLT) : If Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 is true (one) then branch to statement at label's address

bc1t 1,label.description: Branch if specified FP condition flag true (BC1T, not BCLT) : If Coprocessor 1 condition flag specified by immediate is true (one) then branch to statement at label's address

bc1f label.description: Branch if FP condition flag 0 false (BC1F, not BCLF) : If Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 is false (zero) then branch to statement at label's address

bc1f 1,label.description: Branch if specified FP condition flag false (BC1F, not BCLF) : If Coprocessor 1 condition flag specified by immediate is false (zero) then branch to statement at label's address

c.eq.s $f0,$f1.description: Compare equal single precision : If $f0 is equal to $f1, set Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 true else set it false

c.eq.s 1,$f0,$f1.description: Compare equal single precision : If $f0 is equal to $f1, set Coprocessor 1 condition flag specied by immediate to true else set it to false

c.le.s $f0,$f1.description: Compare less or equal single precision : If $f0 is less than or equal to $f1, set Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 true else set it false

c.le.s 1,$f0,$f1.description: Compare less or equal single precision : If $f0 is less than or equal to $f1, set Coprocessor 1 condition flag specified by immediate to true else set it to false

c.lt.s $f0,$f1.description: Compare less than single precision : If $f0 is less than $f1, set Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 true else set it false

c.lt.s 1,$f0,$f1.description: Compare less than single precision : If $f0 is less than $f1, set Coprocessor 1 condition flag specified by immediate to true else set it to false

c.eq.d $f2,$f4.description: Compare equal double precision : If $f2 is equal to $f4 (double-precision), set Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 true else set it false

c.eq.d 1,$f2,$f4.description: Compare equal double precision : If $f2 is equal to $f4 (double-precision), set Coprocessor 1 condition flag specified by immediate to true else set it to false

c.le.d $f2,$f4.description: Compare less or equal double precision : If $f2 is less than or equal to $f4 (double-precision), set Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 true else set it false

c.le.d 1,$f2,$f4.description: Compare less or equal double precision : If $f2 is less than or equal to $f4 (double-precision), set Coprocessor 1 condition flag specfied by immediate true else set it false

c.lt.d $f2,$f4.description: Compare less than double precision : If $f2 is less than $f4 (double-precision), set Coprocessor 1 condition flag 0 true else set it false

c.lt.d 1,$f2,$f4.description: Compare less than double precision : If $f2 is less than $f4 (double-precision), set Coprocessor 1 condition flag specified by immediate to true else set it to false

abs.s $f0,$f1.description: Floating point absolute value single precision : Set $f0 to absolute value of $f1, single precision

abs.d $f2,$f4.description: Floating point absolute value double precision : Set $f2 to absolute value of $f4, double precision

cvt.d.s $f2,$f1.description: Convert from single precision to double precision : Set $f2 to double precision equivalent of single precision value in $f1

cvt.d.w $f2,$f1.description: Convert from word to double precision : Set $f2 to double precision equivalent of 32-bit integer value in $f1

cvt.s.d $f1,$f2.description: Convert from double precision to single precision : Set $f1 to single precision equivalent of double precision value in $f2

cvt.s.w $f0,$f1.description: Convert from word to single precision : Set $f0 to single precision equivalent of 32-bit integer value in $f2

cvt.w.d $f1,$f2.description: Convert from double precision to word : Set $f1 to 32-bit integer equivalent of double precision value in $f2

cvt.w.s $f0,$f1.description: Convert from single precision to word : Set $f0 to 32-bit integer equivalent of single precision value in $f1

mov.d $f2,$f4.description: Move floating point double precision : Set double precision $f2 to double precision value in $f4

movf.d $f2,$f4.description: Move floating point double precision : If condition flag 0 false, set double precision $f2 to double precision value in $f4

movf.d $f2,$f4,1.description: Move floating point double precision : If condition flag specified by immediate is false, set double precision $f2 to double precision value in $f4

movt.d $f2,$f4.description: Move floating point double precision : If condition flag 0 true, set double precision $f2 to double precision value in $f4

movt.d $f2,$f4,1.description: Move floating point double precision : If condition flag specified by immediate is true, set double precision $f2 to double precision value in $f4e

movn.d $f2,$f4,$t3.description: Move floating point double precision : If $t3 is not zero, set double precision $f2 to double precision value in $f4

movz.d $f2,$f4,$t3.description: Move floating point double precision : If $t3 is zero, set double precision $f2 to double precision value in $f4

mov.s $f0,$f1.description: Move floating point single precision : Set single precision $f0 to single precision value in $f1

movf.s $f0,$f1.description: Move floating point single precision : If condition flag 0 is false, set single precision $f0 to single precision value in $f1

movf.s $f0,$f1,1.description: Move floating point single precision : If condition flag specified by immediate is false, set single precision $f0 to single precision value in $f1e

movt.s $f0,$f1.description: Move floating point single precision : If condition flag 0 is true, set single precision $f0 to single precision value in $f1e

movt.s $f0,$f1,1.description: Move floating point single precision : If condition flag specified by immediate is true, set single precision $f0 to single precision value in $f1e

movn.s $f0,$f1,$t3.description: Move floating point single precision : If $t3 is not zero, set single precision $f0 to single precision value in $f1

movz.s $f0,$f1,$t3.description: Move floating point single precision : If $t3 is zero, set single precision $f0 to single precision value in $f1

mfc1 $t1,$f1.description: Move from Coprocessor 1 (FPU) : Set $t1 to value in Coprocessor 1 register $f1

mtc1 $t1,$f1.description: Move to Coprocessor 1 (FPU) : Set Coprocessor 1 register $f1 to value in $t1

neg.d $f2,$f4.description: Floating point negate double precision : Set double precision $f2 to negation of double precision value in $f4

neg.s $f0,$f1.description: Floating point negate single precision : Set single precision $f0 to negation of single precision value in $f1

lwc1 $f1,-100($t2).description: Load word into Coprocessor 1 (FPU) : Set $f1 to 32-bit value from effective memory word address

ldc1 $f2,-100($t2).description: Load double word Coprocessor 1 (FPU)) : Set $f2 to 64-bit value from effective memory doubleword address

swc1 $f1,-100($t2).description: Store word from Coprocesor 1 (FPU) : Store 32 bit value in $f1 to effective memory word address

sdc1 $f2,-100($t2).description: Store double word from Coprocessor 1 (FPU)) : Store 64 bit value in $f2 to effective memory doubleword address

teq $t1,$t2.description: Trap if equal : Trap if $t1 is equal to $t2

teqi $t1,-100.description: Trap if equal to immediate : Trap if $t1 is equal to sign-extended 16 bit immediate

tne $t1,$t2.description: Trap if not equal : Trap if $t1 is not equal to $t2

tnei $t1,-100.description: Trap if not equal to immediate : Trap if $t1 is not equal to sign-extended 16 bit immediate

tge $t1,$t2.description: Trap if greater or equal : Trap if $t1 is greater than or equal to $t2

tgeu $t1,$t2.description: Trap if greater or equal unsigned : Trap if $t1 is greater than or equal to $t2 using unsigned comparision

tgei $t1,-100.description: Trap if greater than or equal to immediate : Trap if $t1 greater than or equal to sign-extended 16 bit immediate

tgeiu $t1,-100.description: Trap if greater or equal to immediate unsigned : Trap if $t1 greater than or equal to sign-extended 16 bit immediate, unsigned comparison

tltu $t1,$t2.description: Trap if less than unsigned : Trap if $t1 less than $t2, unsigned comparison

tlti $t1,-100.description: Trap if less than immediate : Trap if $t1 less than sign-extended 16-bit immediate

tltiu $t1,-100.description: Trap if less than immediate unsigned : Trap if $t1 less than sign-extended 16-bit immediate, unsigned comparison

eret.description: Exception return : Set Program Counter to Coprocessor 0 EPC register value, set Coprocessor Status register bit 1 (exception level) to zero
